text.section: A finding of good cause under this section may be based on any relevant evidence including credible hearsay.

section.section:
For good cause shown, a court with jurisdiction over a criminal matter or juvenile delinquency case may pass an order that is reasonably necessary to stop or prevent:
the intimidation of a victim or witness; or
a violation of this subtitle.
The court may hold a hearing to determine if an order should be issued under this subsection.
The court may use its contempt power to enforce an order issued under this section.

The court may revoke the pretrial release of a defendant or child respondent to ensure the safety of a victim or witness or the integrity of the judicial process if the defendant or child respondent violates an order passed under this section.

text.section: A District Court commissioner or an intake officer, as defined in § 3-8A-01 of the Courts Article, may impose for good cause shown a condition described in subsection (b)(2) of this section as a condition of the pretrial release of a defendant or child respondent.
